creditline: Gift of Edward Duff Balken, Class of 1897
inscribed:
in brown ink, top of margin: A pretty good likeness of Jerome [?] Keith Spence
in ink, on verso, text of letter fragment [?]: Boston 24th June | Hon. William Eustes | sir from the present | alarming situation situation [sic] of the | Country & from a conviction. 
in white chalk, on former strainer: S. Palmer [repeated] Cas [?] Blair. Esq. | Peter

bibliography.boilertext: "Recent Acquisitions," Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 18, no. 1 (1959): p. 40-42.
bibliography.citation: "Recent Acquisitions," Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 18, no. 1 (1959): p. 40-42., p. 40

bibliography.boilertext: John Wilmerding et al., American Art in the Princeton University Art Museum: volume 1: drawings and watercolors, (Princeton: Princeton University Art Museum; New Haven, CT; London: Yale University Press, 2004)
bibliography.citation: John Wilmerding et al., American Art in the Princeton University Art Museum: volume 1: drawings and watercolors, (Princeton: Princeton University Art Museum; New Haven, CT; London: Yale University Press, 2004), p. 320, checklist no. 493 (illus.); p. 351, checklist no. 1069

bibliography.boilertext: "Another generation's folk art: Edward Duff Balken and his collection of American provincial paintings and drawings: appendix I: an inventory of works from the home of Edward Duff Balken", special issue, Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 57, no. 1/2 (1998): p. 29-30.
bibliography.citation: "Another generation's folk art: Edward Duff Balken and his collection of American provincial paintings and drawings: appendix I: an inventory of works from the home of Edward Duff Balken", special issue, Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 57, no. 1/2 (1998): p. 29-30., p. 29

bibliography.boilertext: Colleen Cowles Heslip and Charlotte Emans Moore, "Catalogue of the collection," in "A window into collecting American folk art: the Edward Duff Balken Collection at Princeton," special issue, Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University, 57, no. 1/2 (1998): p. 31-162.
bibliography.citation: Colleen Cowles Heslip and Charlotte Emans Moore, "Catalogue of the collection," in "A window into collecting American folk art: the Edward Duff Balken Collection at Princeton," special issue, Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University, 57, no. 1/2 (1998): p. 31-162., pp. 104–105, cat. no. 104 (illus.)

caption: American, Portrait of Jerome Keith Spence, ca. 1810 – 1820. Watercolor; 12.6 × 10.2 cm (sight). Gift of Edward Duff Balken, Class of 1897 (x1958-59)
